title: Rubio Says ‘Time Is Running Out’ for Gaza Deal
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke about Gaza ahead of a short Tuesday visit to Qatar, which is angry over an Israeli strike against Hamas leaders on its territory.

title: Israel Is Committing Genocide in Gaza, U.N. Inquiry Says
summary: In earlier reports, the commission found that Israel had committed war crimes and crimes against humanity in its conflict with Hamas, but stopped short of calling it genocide. Israel denounced the accusation as “fake.”

title: U.N. Inquiry Says Israel Is Committing Genocide, and Trump Threatens Crackdown on Liberal Groups
summary: Plus, a “sci-fi” discovery about ants.

title: Robert Redford, Screen Idol Turned Director and Activist, Dies at 89
summary: He made serious topics like grief and political corruption resonate with the masses, in no small part because of his own star power.

title: Federal Reserve to Meet Under Cloud of Trump’s Attacks
summary: Stephen Miran and Lisa Cook will both cast votes at the central bank’s meeting on Wednesday, where policymakers are expected to lower interest rates.

title: Appeals Court Says Lisa Cook Can Remain on Fed Board
summary: The decision came the day before the Federal Reserve begins a two-day meeting at which policymakers are expected to cut interest rates.

title: Senate Confirms Stephen Miran as Fed Governor
summary: The Senate voted to install one of President Trump’s top economic advisers at the central bank, opening the door for him to cast a vote at this week’s meeting to set interest rates.

title: F.B.I. Agents Fired by Patel Speak Out on ‘Broken’ Trust
summary: The two agents’ accounts offer an inside view of a bureau buffeted by politics and upheaval, adding to the scrutiny of the F.B.I. director as he prepares to testify to Congress.

title: 20 Years Ago, Alinea Electrified Chicago Dining. Does It Still Matter?
summary: At this famously innovative restaurant, our critic finds a mix of thought-provoking experiments and empty spectacle.

title: On Charlie Kirk Show, JD Vance Talks of Crackdown on Liberal Groups
summary: Some of the highest-ranking officials in the federal government used Charlie Kirk’s podcast, guest-hosted by Vice President JD Vance, to lay out their plans.

title: How the Government Is Trying to Silence Charlie Kirk’s Critics
summary: We look at the fight over free speech.

title: Republicans Honor Charlie Kirk at Vigil in the Capitol
summary: Only a handful of Democrats and none of the party’s top leaders attended the ceremony, an outpouring of praise and mourning for the right-wing activist, who was assassinated last week.

title: Trump Leaves Tense America Behind for Royal Retreat on U.K. State Visit
summary: President Trump’s trip to Britain will involve horse-drawn carriages and a stay in an ancient castle. For British officials, the visit may feel less like a fairy tale.

title: President Trump’s State Visit to the UK: What to Know
summary: The president and the first lady will be hosted by King Charles III and Queen Camilla at Windsor Castle. Mr. Trump will also travel to the prime minister’s country residence, Chequers.

title: U.S. Strikes a 2nd Venezuela Boat, Killing 3, Trump Says
summary: The president said the vessel was heading to the United States, but he did not offer details about its location. Legal specialists condemned the action as illegal.

title: Federal Judge Declines to Intervene for Migrants Deported to Ghana
summary: Judge Tanya S. Chutkan said her hands were “tied” with regard to the migrants, even though they held protective orders, in another victory for President Trump’s deportation campaign.

title: How China Is Weathering the Trade War With Trump
summary: Tariffs triggered a plunge in China’s exports to the United States, but its global trade surplus is larger because sales to other regions are surging.

title: With a Hashtag, Young Chinese Are Mourning the ‘Beauty of the Boom Years’
summary: Nostalgia for the fashion and culture of the years after the millennium, when the future held promise for many, is a commentary on today’s mood.

title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Committee Likely to Target Hepatitis B Shot for Newborns
summary: Committee members, some of whom are vaccine skeptics, are likely to recommend restricting the use of the shots at birth or delaying them until later in childhood.

title: Hepatitis B Vaccine, Once a Public Health Win, Is Under Threat From RFK Jr.
summary: Rates of the disease have fallen since 1991, when a vaccine committee recommended all newborns receive the shot.

title: Denmark’s Parenting Test Becomes the Latest Flashpoint in Greenland
summary: The case of a young Greenlandic woman who was ruled incapable of keeping her baby has become the latest flashpoint with Denmark.

title: What Exactly Are A.I. Companies Trying to Build? Here’s a Guide.
summary: Amazon, Microsoft, Google, Meta and OpenAI plan to spend at least $325 billion by the end of the year in pursuit of A.I. We explain why they’re doing it.

title: Jennifer Lopez’s Life Is Her Greatest Art. These 7 Roles Explain Why.
summary: Her casting in the forthcoming “Kiss of the Spider Woman” underscores how her best onscreen work has always been informed by what’s happening offscreen.

title: The Kirk Crackdown Is Underway
summary: The idea that there is more left-wing extremist violence than right-wing extremist violence is a dangerous myth.

title: My U.N. Commission’s Finding: Israel Is Committing Genocide
summary: The chief judge of the Rwandan genocide tribunal has concluded that Israel is guilty of the “crime of crimes” in Gaza.

title: Late Night Finds Trump Strangely Fascinated by the White House Ballroom
summary: “Every time he gets a chance to talk about it, he sounds likes one of my kids,” Seth Meyers said.

title: Former Republican Lt. Governor of Georgia Enters Governor’s Race as a Democrat
summary: Geoff Duncan could prove to be a wild card in an election next year that will be a crucial test for Georgia’s relatively new status as a swing state.

title: ‘Squid Game’ Star Lee Jung-jae Talks About Korean Fan Culture
summary: Lee Jung-jae, who has been a star in South Korea for decades, said social media has made audiences more zealous. He thinks he knows how to keep them happy.

title: Which Living Democrat Does Cuomo Admire? He Can’t Name One.
summary: In an interview with The New York Times, former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, a lifelong Democrat, said the party “is not meeting the moment.”
